intro: Sideroxylon glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, spiny capsules containing seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
